author: yahoo
title: Apple's breakdown temporary: Halftime traders
text:
Even though the broader stock market is trading around seven-week highs, one major stock is sitting on the sidelines. Apple is on track for its worst yearly performance since 2008 .
The "Halftime Report" traders zeroed in on the iPhone maker.

"I think there is an ownership change as people have looked at this as a growth stock and realizing, 'No, it's a value stock,' and that's going to take some time to play out," said Jim Lebenthal, who is long Apple .
Pete Najarian, who also owns shares, acknowledged that there is a rotation underway but is still bullish on Apple long-term.
The stock has fallen by double-digits over the past six months. 
Trader disclosure: On October 12, 2015, the following stocks and commodities mentioned or intended to be mentioned on CNBC's "Halftime Report" were owned by the "Halftime Report" traders: Pete Najarian is long AAPL, AMAT, BAC, BMY, BP, CSX, DIS, DISCA, DKS, FOXA, GE, KKR, KO, MRK, PEP, PFE, PHM he is long calls ABX, AGN, BEE, ETFC, F, FL, GPRO, JOY, LM, LUK, MAS, MPEL, PBR, SWFT, UAL, VALE, VZ, ZIOP, he is long puts DISH, EWW, FCX, MRO, TNK, TSLA, X. Steve Weiss is long AAL, C, CDK, CVC, CYBX, FB, GILD, LULU, NCR, THC, TWTR. Jim Lebenthal is long AAPL, BA, C, CSCO, DCO, EEQ, GAIA, GM, IBM, INTC, JCP, MPC, OA, ORBC, PFE, QCOM, SJT, SPLS, TGT, TIF, TRN, WGO.
